metadata.title: CVE-2019-8324 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.6 and later through 3.0.2. A craftedgem with a multi-line name is not handled correctly. Therefore, an attackercould inject arbitrary code to the stub line of gemspec, which is eval-edby code in ensure_loadable_spec during the preinstall check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2
ruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2').
jruby: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
